docs.name: MaterialStepperComponent
docs.comment:
A material-design-styled stepper.

A stepper is a numbered indicator used to convey progress or function as a navigational tool.

Warning: content is reparented to the stepper component itself so any @ViewChild(ren) queries for content inside of a step or summary template will not work in the original component.

inputs.name: announceCurrentStep
inputs.comment: When true, assertively announces the current step via aria live region.

inputs.name: keepInactiveStepsInDom
inputs.comment:
When true, steps will not be unloaded from the dom when inactive, but will rather be hidden via css.

This allows for fast switching between steps with DOMs that are expensive to load.

inputs.name: legalJumps
inputs.comment:
Jumps (defined as step-switches not triggered by the Continue/Cancel buttons) that are legal.

Possible values:

  • 'none' (default; no jumps allowed),
  • 'backwards'(jumps to already completed steps allowed),
  • 'all' (any jump allowed, regardless of the step state).

inputs.name: noText
inputs.comment: Text to be displayed on the button that goes back to the former step. By default, displays "Cancel".

inputs.name: orientation
inputs.comment:
Orientation in which the steps are laid out.

Possible values: 'horizontal' and 'vertical' (default).

inputs.name: size
inputs.comment:
Size theme which in turn determines sizes of various step header elements (e.g., the step number, step name, etc.).

Possible values: 'default' (default) and 'mini'.

inputs.name: stickyHeader
inputs.comment:
Indicates whether the header, which lists the available steps, should stick to the top of the page.

Applicable only to steppers with horizontal header.

inputs.name: yesText
inputs.comment: Text to be displayed on the button that goes to the next step. By default, displays "Continue".

outputs.name: activeStepChanged
outputs.comment: Event that fires when the active step has changed.

docs.name: StepDirective
docs.comment:
A step within the stepper.

Warning: content is reparented to the stepper component itself so any @ViewChild(ren) queries for content inside of a step or summary template will not work in the original component.

inputs.name: canContinue
inputs.comment:
Whether the step can continue.

This can be used to prevent continuing on from a step until all parts of the current step meet validation requirements.

inputs.name: cancelHidden
inputs.comment: Whether the cancel button should be hidden on this step.

inputs.name: complete
inputs.comment:
Whether the step is completed.

This is set when the stepper goes to the next step.

inputs.name: completeSummary
inputs.comment: Summary text shown when the step is completed in a vertical default-sized stepper. For other steppers, this doesn't apply.

inputs.name: hideButtons
inputs.comment: Whether the buttons should be hidden on this step.

inputs.name: optional
inputs.comment: Whether the step is optional. Optional steps have an extra label denoting that they're optional and should be skip-able. Default is false.

outputs.name: cancelStream
outputs.comment:
Called when the Cancel button is clicked.

If the event handler calls $event.cancel(), the step won't be cancelled.

outputs.name: continueStream
outputs.comment:
Called when the Continue button is clicked.

If the event handler calls $event.cancel(), the step won't be continued.

outputs.name: jumpStream
outputs.comment:
Called when the user wants to jump to this step.

If the event handler calls $event.cancel(), the step won't be continued.
